availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Coleman Garrard (Pendleton County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer. Harrison County, Kentucky, native. Son of Thomas Lewis Garrard and America Grace Coleman. Married to Mary Bedford Garrard in Pendleton County, Kentucky, on February 3, 1857. Father of Thomas L. Garrard, Emma L. Garrard, Joseph D. Garrard, James Garrard, Catherine Garrard, Francis “Frank” P. Garrard, Cicely Garrard, and Lee Garrard. Attended Cincinnati College in Cincinnati, Ohio, in 1837. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1850. Employed Thomas L. Garrard as a farmworker in Pendleton County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Pendleton County in 1850. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Pendleton County in 1860. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1863.
